body: thanks @XD-DENG :)
PTAL @milton0825
lgtm
cc GCP folks @fenglu-g @potiuk
cc @KevinYang21

@cong-zhu Do we have unit test for this feature before? If so we'll still need to update it so we capture the use case which this PR is fixing, if not we might want to add that test. Also the CI is failing now, if you're still working on it then you can mark the PR as a WIP PR by putting a `[WIP]` into the PR title.
will take a look at the pr tomorrow

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/airflow/pull/5200?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [7e2a807...aa16653](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/airflow/pull/5200?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
We can modify the source  - I personally wouldn't have bothered so that the vendored libraries are as close as possible to stock just so that seeing our _important_ changes is as easy as possible.
We probably want this fix as it is against v1-10-stable branch to fix this for 1.10.4.
@jmcarp Yeah sounds right. Do you have time to write the vote email summarizing the changes or would you like me to pick this up?
@potiuk PTAL
@languitar Yup, has already been cherry-picked back to the v1-10-stable branch so will be included in 1.10.4

I would like to revive the discussion around this PR as I feel it adds helpful functionality. My scenario is that I need a DAG to run Tuesday Through Saturday populating data for the previous day, at first pass this seems like the out of the box configuration with a 1-5 schedule would work but as we all know with the run at end of interval logic, execution date Friday doesn't kick until Monday, and I need it to go on Saturday. I know I can work around this by adding a short circuit operator and running the dag everyday, but then I have to add an extra operator to every dag that I want to behave this way and if I'm looking at dag run times, I'll have artificially lower numbers on the weekends.
@XD-DENG and Airflow team - Please let me know if there is anything else outstanding that I need to address for this PR.  Thanks.
Target against AIRFLOW-571 please.

@XD-DENG any further questions?
Done, thanks for the heads up @RosterIn
Hi @Fokko , no other comment from my side. Thanks!
That `.join()` issue could be the cause of num_runs not working for Kube executor - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-4424.

You are. And prior to this change when remote storage was enabled the logs form FileProcessorHandler weren't written to remote storage either - it instead never got written _anywhere_ (as the file couldn't be opened, so didn't get logged in the first place to upload upon `close()`)
Thanks @Fokko @kaxil
Trying to think through what the implications of _not_ joining on that queue are. Given we've already terminated the process probably minimal right?

Yep. It wasn't there before. so we had it all the time till now. It is indeed only case where we could not terminate the processes which  should only be problem in case of some hardware problems  I believe as for now we are terminating them with KILL eventually.
lgtm
